page.title: 09THE OUTSKIRTS OF N.WALSHAM
page.content: Coming into town on the A149,S&M is the next firm after Marricks and Cranes.they started up in 1976,supplying firms in norfolk with timber building materials-9 people work there. (It is near the junction of the A149 and the B1145(Greens Road)).This is the residential part now,including Suffield close, Kingsway, and if you go on towards the town under a railway bridge Bradfield road is off to your left.Most of the houses were built in the 1930's-the bungalows were built in the 1960's. Bradfield Road has an OfLicense/shop. The road goes to the edge of town then Antingham,Bradfield and Lyngate.You go over the railway line and on the left is the back of Crane Fruehauf,in front you can see an enormous scrap yard.The next right will get you to the Industrial Estate North on the bypass.
